intro: Pentamerista neotropica, commonly known as the Neotropical starflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Despite its ornamental appeal, it is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
